verses.name: Acts 19:35
verses.text: And when the townclerk had appeased the people, he said, Ye men of Ephesus, what man is there that knoweth not how that the city of the Ephesians is a worshipper of the great goddess Diana, and of the image which fell down from Jupiter?

verses.name: Acts 19:36
verses.text: Seeing then that these things cannot be spoken against, ye ought to be quiet, and to do nothing rashly.

verses.name: Acts 19:37
verses.text: For ye have brought hither these men, which are neither robbers of churches, nor yet blasphemers of your goddess.
